intro: Osmoxylon oliveri, commonly known as the Oliver's osmoxylon, is a rare and woody plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive bark. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and exhibits a slow growth rate. Its botanical features include alternate leaves and a unique floral structure that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
